title: INtopBackup

items.title: Stock market rout deepens as Dow plunges more than 2,200 points
items.description: Stocks continued to tumble in the U.S. Friday as financial markets suffered their biggest two-day drop since 2020.

items.title: Midwest, South hit with rain and flooding amid tornado recovery
items.description: Parts of the Midwest and South were hit with rain and flooding even as many communities were still reeling from tornadoes that killed several people.

items.title: Rubio dismisses criticism over US response to Myanmar quake
items.description: The US has been accused of not doing enough to help Myanmar due to the shuttering of its humanitarian aid agency.

items.title: Trump's tariffs could be death knell for  US-Africa trade pact
items.description: Some African countries got privileged access to US markets, but the future of that deal is uncertain.

items.title: 3 family members hit, killed by Amtrak train near Philadelphia
items.description: Amtrak service between Philadelphia and New York was halted for hours after three family members were struck and killed by a train in Bucks County.

items.title: Spain tackles housing 'social emergency' as rents double in a decade
items.description: The Spanish government is moving to make renting more affordable and boost the supply of homes.

items.title: Trump's agenda grapples with political and economic reality
items.description: Trump says it’s all going to plan but stock market turmoil plus struggles at home and abroad show how hard it is to deliver as president.

items.title: Trump extends deadline to keep TikTok running in US
items.description: The president has granted the app a second 75-day extension to comply with a law that requires it to either sell its US assets or face a ban.
